ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Thamud and 'Ad denied the Crushing Blow.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The Thamud and 'Ad denied the consequential calamity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: The Thamud and the Ad denied the (possibility of a) sudden calamity, calling it false.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The people of Thamud and Ad denied the Day of Judgment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The tribes of Thamud and A’ad denied the event of great dismay. (The Day of Resurrection)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Samood and Ad called the striking calamity a lie.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Thamood and Ad cried lies to the Clatterer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (The tribes of) Thamud and A'ad disbelieved in the judgment to come.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The tribes of Thamud and 'Ad denied that disaster would strike them:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: The tribes of Thamud and 'Aad belied the Striking Day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The Thamud and the 'Ad People (branded) as false the Stunning Calamity!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Thamud and 'Ad people denied the Qari'ah [the striking Hour (of Judgement)]!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Thamood and Aad belied the Clatterer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Thamood and Aad denied the Catastrophe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Thamud and 'Aad denied the Striking Calamity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [69:4] Thamūd and ‘Ād denied the Clatterer, the Resurrection, because its terrors cause the hearts to clatter.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: ((The tribes of) Thamud) the people of Salih (and 'Aad) the people of Hud (disbelieved in the judgement to come) in the coming of the Hour.
